{% raw %}

Config¶

class Config[source]

Config() :: dict

dict() -> new empty dictionary dict(mapping) -> new dictionary initialized from a mapping object's (key, value) pairs dict(iterable) -> new dictionary initialized as if via: d = {} for k, v in iterable: d[k] = v dict(**kwargs) -> new dictionary initialized with the name=value pairs in the keyword argument list. For example: dict(one=1, two=2)

first[source]

first(d, key)

getall[source]

getall(d, key)

dict.items

<method 'items' of 'dict' objects>
config = Config(a = 1,z=3,b=2,c=[dict(d=5,e=6,z=5),dict(g=7,h=dict(i=8,z=6))])
config.pretty_print()

{
    "a": 1,
    "z": 3,
    "b": 2,
    "c": [
        {
            "d": 5,
            "e": 6,
            "z": 5
        },
        {
            "g": 7,
            "h": {
                "i": 8,
                "z": 6
            }
        }
    ]
}

config.first("z")

3
config.getall("z")

[3, 5, 6]

Pretty print config¶

Config(a=1,b=2).pretty_print()

{
    "a": 1,
    "b": 2
}

Multiple ways of setting config¶

config = Config(a=1,b=2)(c=5)(d=6)
config.e=12

config

{'a': 1, 'b': 2, 'c': 5, 'd': 6, 'e': 12}

Save and load json¶

config.save("test.json")
!cat test.json

{"a": 1, "b": 2, "c": 5, "d": 6, "e": 12}
Config.load("test.json")

{'a': 1, 'b': 2, 'c': 5, 'd': 6, 'e': 12}
!rm test.json
{% endraw %}
